definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: Remember the terrible accident that opened each episode of the old television show?
sentences.chinese: 想起舊電視節目上展開每段情節的可怕事件了嗎？

sentences.english: Reception of TV programmes is unsatisfactory here.
sentences.chinese: 這裏電視節目的接收情況不佳。

sentences.english: The first television broadcasts began in 1936.
sentences.chinese: BBC在1936年播出了第一個電視節目。

sentences.english: There’s nothing good on TV tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚沒什麼好看的電視節目。

sentences.english: I watch TV with subtitles and the volume cranked up.
sentences.chinese: 我看的是帶字幕的電視節目，音量調得很大。

sentences.english: Johnny Chan is the planner and presenter of a TV program which covers a diverse range of topics.
sentences.chinese: 陳奕文先生是一檔電視節目的籌辦者和主持人。

sentences.english: Teachers can also make good use of television programmes.
sentences.chinese: 另外，電視節目也是一個讓老師“借力”的好地方。

sentences.english: Smart TV mobile phone, analog TV, can record TV shows.
sentences.chinese: 智能TV手機，模擬電視，可錄製電視節目。

sentences.english: Parents must, there- fore, keep an eye on what their children watch.
sentences.chinese: 因此，父母們應該留意孩子所看的電視節目。

sentences.english: The pair appeared together in a television show.
sentences.chinese: 他兩人一起參加了一個電視節目。

sentences.english: The show then cut away to the weatherman。
sentences.chinese: 於是電視節目被切成了天氣預報。

sentences.english: It looks like reality TV shows are here to stay.
sentences.chinese: 看來真人真事的電視節目已成爲風潮。

sentences.english: She had roles in several movies and television programs.
sentences.chinese: 她在幾部電影和電視節目中的角色。

sentences.english: So what is your favorite TV program?
sentences.chinese: 那麼你最喜歡的電視節目是什麼？

sentences.english: She came on the show to plug her latest album.
sentences.chinese: 她出現在電視節目上，推廣她的新唱片專輯。

sentences.english: These days the 11th National Games are the hottest TV shows.
sentences.chinese: 這些天11屆全運會是最熱門的電視節目了。

definition: broadcast/CL:個|个[ge4]/broadcasting/to broadcast/(formal) to propagate/to publicize
regular column or segment (in a publication or broadcast program)/program (TV or radio)
live (e.g. broadcast or recording)/what is actually happening/scene/the real situation
